title: Maybe Vermeer Made the Shroud of Turin
post: Roger Bacon (1220-1292) woud be spot on for a C14 date of ~1250, one of the first experimentalists, he knew about lenses (spectacles had barely entered the western world), influenced by Robert Grosseteste, familiar with alchemy, experimented with the camera obscura. But commodity of crucifixion victims in short supply ~1250. Also he’d have to create the image without pigments. Also more of an experimentalist and discoverer, rather than inventive genius. Otherwise, an interesting possibility!
